name: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge

reviews.text: My family of four was at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for just under a week. We stayed, as ordinary hotel guests, in one of the "Vacation Club" suites -- ours overlooked the giraffe savanna -- with one comfortable but modestly-sized bedroom, one large bathroom, and a main area consisting of a sitting area with couch convertible to bed for the kids, a dining area, and a full kitchen.
reviews.title: Good to very good option for family

reviews.text: The value proposition here was about B+/A-. The rate was very expensive but for the space we got, it was pretty reasonable, particularly given that it was in an overall rate with a premium dining plan (a real necessity at Disney if one is to really enjoy it) and park ticket plan.
reviews.title: Great Hotel but Wasn't the Best Disney Experience

likes.disliked: — Price, food, front desk staff, distance from Disney parks

reviews.text: The suite's fit and finish was a solid A- to A -- nicely done kitchen, very well done bathroom, and decent bedroom and living room furniture. I could see how people could use this space for longer-term stays.
reviews.title: A Quiet Location away from it all!!

reviews.text: Housekeeping, room noise, appliance and fixture functionality, were all fine. The hotel was able to accommodate an engineering request that in my experience many hotels won't accommodate (moving a DVD player from the living room to the bedroom). The check-in and check-
reviews.title: Great Family Hotel

reviews.text: out experiences were wholly adequate. While we did not use the hotel's airport baggage pick-up and shuttle, we did use the system for on-
reviews.title: great family fun, will be going back!

reviews.text: We are annual visitors to Disney World and usually stay at a moderate hotel. This time we decided to splurge a little and I am so glad we did! We booked a savannah view room with bunk beds. We arrived very late the first night and were given a room with a lovely view of the roof of the utility building. They could not move us that night but we were well taken care of the next morning and all of our belongings were moved to our new room for us while we were at the park. The staff was very understanding. The next morning we ate breakfast on the balcony and watched the giraffes and zebras feed. The kids were absolutely delighted and we almost couldn't get them in to get ready to hit the parks. We even saw a baby giraffe with mama. Obviously, the presence of animals can be hit and miss but there was always something outside of our room. The hotel itself is beautiful. The bunk bed rooms seemed a tad bit cramped but it was workable. Breakfast was easily available at Mara to eat in or take back to the room. Both check-in and check-out (including checking our luggage) was a breeze. I would say the only major downside to this hotel is the location and it can be quite a long bus ride to the parks. However that would not keep me from staying here again.
reviews.title: One of a Kind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My new wife and I stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge for our Honeymoon and loved the room. We had an Arusha Savannah view. The only complaint I could possibly have (which is a little beyond human control) is the fact there were not a lot of animals for us to view. We paid extra for the "best savannah" and there were not a lot of animals. The one day we saw a lot was the day we came home early from the parks. Other than that, the hotel is amazing and the service is incredible. Since we really only used the hotel for a place to sleep we think next Disney trip we will stay in a Value Resort. (We stayed here because of a Disney special to get some percentage off our stay)
reviews.title: Disney Honeymoon

reviews.text: We stayed at The Animal Kingdom Lodge for a week and found it very enjoyable. We loved the theme and had a savannah view room. There aren't many places in this part of the world where you can sit on your hotel balcony watching zebras, giraffes, ostriches etc. It was lovely!
reviews.title: Very nice! But a few little touch ups needed

reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: I expected more from Disney

reviews.text: I was a little worried about the location after reading some of the reviews. AKL is a bit further out than some of the other hotels. However there were absolutely no problems with the location. The buses were very reliable and it didn't take too long to get anywhere. We never waited too long for a bus to arrive. There really is no need for a car if you are planning to stay within Disney World.
reviews.title: Noisy beds

reviews.text: Although we had a great time & the hotel was adequate I thought you'd like to hear some of the negatives I found. This property is one of Disney's more pricey resorts & it certainly did not have the ammenities of a 4 star hotel. I was surprised that there was no phone in the bathroom nor adequate lighting. The toilet & bath shared the space & the light fixture was near the toilet, so you are basically showering in the dark. There is no mini bar if you want a quick snack or drink and our room was so far away from the lobby we relied on the pricier room service. We had a Savannah View room with bunk bed & queen bed. Our room was at the end of the Savannah so we did not have the greatest view, although we did see quite a few animals. Others have commented that the room was small. It was fine for the 3 of us. I have stayed at other Disney Resorts & by comparison this would rank (in my opinion) as a 6 out of 10. The staff was very friendly & the hotel very clean. It was just lacking some of the "extras" I had expected.
reviews.title: Not a premier property

likes.liked: — That my grandaughter enjoyed watching the animals from our balcony

reviews.text: Whilst the Disney hotels are usually very expensive we got a very reasonable deal through Expedia - so a tip is to check these out rather than go direct. The free Disney transfer took the hassle out of getting to and from the airport and was included for free. The hotel setting is amazing, the inside has a distinct African savanna theme and the animals walk right up to the hotel perimeter (great viewing platforms throughout the hotel). The rooms were very well proportioned and the African theme continued. The pool was huge, with a slide for younger children, there was ample room around the pool to sunbathe if you wished and there was a jacuzzi also. One of the best things about this hotel was the food. The hotel had three main restaurants. One was quite formal called Jiko (which we didnt eat in), one was very informal The Mara - better if you wanted a quick snack at lunch and the main restuarant called Boma - was a self service restaurant but the choice and quality of the food was excellent. I dont often eat in hotel restaurants and never from a self service restuarant but the food really was that good we ate hereat least 4 nights of our 10 night stay. Breakfast in this restaurant was equally as good. We took advantage of their room service - it has to be said their Chicken Cesar Salad was one of the best ive ever eaten. We had breakfast a few mornings in our room and all the food was fresh and of a high standard. There were two bars (one poolside and one inside the main building). Transport to and from all the Disney parks and downtown Disney was free, efficient and easy to use, with easy access for the disabled. All in all if you want to stay somewhere that little bit special, you cant go wrong with this Disney hotel.
reviews.title: Disney Hotel with a difference

reviews.text: We stayed for one night at the end of an 8 night vacation. We had a savannah-view studio - it was our first stay as DVC members. Check-in was very smooth and we were able to get into our room around 11.
reviews.title: This was my mom's best Mother's Day present!

likes.liked: — Watching the animals from the balcony and the pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was beautiful! We saw lots of animals from our balcony, including giraffes and zebras. The pool was really nice. My son loved the zero-depth entry and waterslide. There was also a great playground. I think his favorite part of the stay was watching Mickey cartoons in the lobby.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but nothing special.

likes.liked: — The theme/decor, free bus service, pool open late, viewing animals.
likes.disliked: — Layout, lack of atmosphere, building work

reviews.text: We've eaten at Boma in the past. Very good, but pricey. It's a good restaurant to experience once. We got breakfast at the quick-service restaurant and were very impressed with the food.
reviews.title: Loved Everything About This Resort!

reviews.text: We absolutely LOVED staying at Disney's Animal Kingdom Resort. We had an incredible view from our room AND our room was conveniently located to the front of the resort which made it perfect for getting to the bus station with our two small daughters. We had a nice shaded view from our balcony with the little river running below us which led to the pool. It was beautiful and relaxing to sit on the porch. The Cast Members at this resort were fabulous. They were willing to help and always had friendly smiles.
reviews.title: A Disney Bonus!

reviews.text: The animals at the resort was a Disney Bonus! It was like being at a park within a resort! My family thoroughly enjoyed walking out to the balconies, watching the animals graze and literally walk within inches of the fence. We loved being able to spend time at the gorgeous pool and enjoyed watching the flamingos from the pool!!! It was a beautiful and very memorable stay.
reviews.title: Amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, amzing experience, great cast members. Resrtaurant was great. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: Recently stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge, Jambo House. It was fabulous and as everything with Disney, there was nothing that was done wrong! I had requested a Savannah view room and was disappointed on check in when we were told it was Pool view. But once I realized, we had a beautiful view of the pool and the Savannah was just beyond the pool and we could see that as well! It was just perfect! Everything very clean, spacious. It was a club level Studio, so we had a continental breakfast daily, snacks all day, wine, beer in the afternoon with more snacks and deserts and wine and Liquors in the evening. This was our first time at a Disney Property and I recommend it highly for so many reasons. The ease of using Disney Transportation and the ease of check in and check out! I was so impressed when we checked our luggage at our home airport and we never saw it until it was delivered to our room! And, when leaving, they printed our boarding passes, took our luggage and again never saw it until we arrived in our home airport. It was all just too easy!! Truly, truly, one of our best vacations ever!
reviews.title: Dated, but worth it

reviews.text: Disneyworld is Los Vegas for short people. Like Vegas, the best experience (if that can be said) is close to the action. At Disneyworld, that means staying on the property.
reviews.title: Wonderful Disney Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed late April into early May for two weeks. Would not stay again due to the fact that; 1) too expensive for the available facilities. 2) wildlife no better than a VERY small zoo. 3) rooms very small and not very clean. 4) to far from the main Disney parks. 5) pool not the most pretty due to broken concrete/colour and cleanliness of water. 6) very small balcony which could only fit two seats on it so the expected family gathering over drinks and watching the animals was impossible and we had an up-graded room...!
reviews.title: There are cheaper hotels...

reviews.text: Is this quality what Disney is all about..? I would expect that a corperation of this stature would have a far higher standard in its Premier Resorts... you pay Disney prices so is it too much to expect the Disney quality that is promoted all over the world..?
reviews.title: Excellent Resort

reviews.text: If the hotlel were half the price then I WOULD consider staying again but as this is not going to happen then on my return to Orlando I will give this hotel a miss.
reviews.title: Great Experience

likes.liked: — Animal views - like sleeping in a zoo
likes.disliked: — Seeing the fence line in the background, put up some thatch or bamboo

reviews.text: Just got back from a week stay at the Animal Kingdom (5-7-08 - 5-14-08) and I cannot say enough great things about the resort. When we first checked in we were given a room with a Savannah View but it was right next to the construction work. There was a hugh construction crane right outside our room. We returned to the front desk and were given new accomodations without any problems. We were then given a pool view room and were very pleased with it. Plenty of places to see the animals. Mousekeeping was fantastic. The room was very nice and comfortable. My kids (6 and 9) loved everything about the resort...the pool, the animals, the arcade, the night vision ect.. The Mara was a great place to grab a quick bite to eat. Never had any problems with the buses. My only complaint would be the bartenders at the pool side bar seemed very crabby all week, they just didn't have that normal "Disney" cheer to them that the rest of the resort employees had.
reviews.title: Great place buses a little slow

reviews.text: Wow, what a great stay at the AKL. I stayed at this hotel for two nights with my Mom and best friend and we had a great view from our balcony. I did book a savannah view room on the Zebra trail. The room was adequate size, not huge but we weren't at Disney to stay in the room. The animals are outside from late afternoon until about 10 in the morning. They can NOT come up to your balcony; there is a carefully disguised barrier that keeps the animal way from the people. The best time to view the animals during our stay was earlier in the morning while it was still cool out. The lobby, halls and rooms are a little darker because of the theme but I enjoyed that because Florida is so bright. We used the cafeteria for the meals we ate there, standard stuff and no waits. Yes, it is expensive to stay here but a nice experience, beautifully decorated and a great staff. The only complaints I have are the bus wait times and the fact they made no effort to conceal the fences in the background.
reviews.title: Would NEVER stay there again or reccomend

reviews.text: .We moved to Animal Kingdom from Yatch club where we thought we were in heaven and were treated with care .At the time of check out I had to profusely thank each and every cast member for the fabulous service. Disney truly made me feel special The standards of service disney stands by and for is lost at this resort where nobody cares for you as an individual. The staff is okay but the managers are indifferent and have an air of arragance and not hospitable. There was chinese food left in the refrigerator that had not been cleaned which stunk up the whole room when we opened the refrigerarator. The room was so dusty ( carpet) and I started wheezing so had to tell them to vacuum it again. My bed creeked every time I moved. .The lobby is beautiful. Savannah view nothing special.
reviews.title: Yatch club excellent but Animal Kingdom lodge is a non service oriented hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at Jambo house on DVC points in a 'Value' studio room. We were honestly expecting parking-lot view, but were surprised to find ourselves looking at the Savannah. Better yet, we opened the curtains to find 4 Giraffes eating! The studio was a good size and our all-in cost for the stay was less than half of what we were paying for a studio at a moderate on cash.
reviews.title: Just like the commercials

reviews.text: The main lobby is breathtaking, as is the architecture of Victoria Falls, Jiko and Boma. The pool area isn't the best on property, but certainly very inviting. Our kids loved the kids club and didn't want to leave.
reviews.title: Jambo House is Magnificent

reviews.text: We also paid a visit to Kadani and we didn't find it as well themed or well appointed, though the pool was a bit better. In Jambo house you really do feel like you are somewhere exotic, from Kadani you can see trees from the entrance and pool that look like north america, not Africa.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Amazing Service, Decent Food, Disney Does it Again!!

reviews.text: Having to take a bus for everything is a dis-advantage compared to the other deluxe resorts, but the value for what you pay is excellent. Even when you are not staying on points, AKL seems to be always much less than other Deluxe resorts.
reviews.title: Average hotel, but kids liked the animals

reviews.text: Walked in with no reservation and got a room for 2 nights. The lobby was nicely decorated, but a bit dark. The room was very nice with an African theme, but my balcony overlooked the hotel entrance. The pool area is large, but the water color thru me off a little. I think it is made to look like a river , but I just like the normal bright blue pool color. When I walked to the animal viewing area, I was shocked to see how far the animals were- not too much of an attraction in my view. I paid over $300.00 per night, and honestly other Disney Resorts are a better value.
reviews.title: Hard to see animals

reviews.text: My husband, 24 year old daughter and I stayed at the Animal Lodge Hotel from 19-25 April 2008 as a special celebration for our silver wedding anniversary and my husband's 65th birthday. We had been warned about the developement but we didn't see or hear any work going on. We were on the Zebra Trail and it was wonderful. The room, with a savannah view, was perfect - not small at all - the service was effecient, friendly and understated. The breakfast selection at the Boma restaurant was plentiful and fresh and the wait for a table was very short. The swimming pool with 3 lifeguards during the day was warm and inviting and a moonlight swim at 10pm one evening was a delight. For me the hi-lite of our stay was watching giraffe from our balcony. There were several animal watching areas with knowledgeable rangers happy to answer questions about the animals. The transportation was brilliant and we never waited for more than 15-20 minutes for a coach from any of the parks or the hotel. We had looked forward to our trip for two years and our expectations were high and we all agreed that it was even better than we had hoped. We would recommend this hotel for anyone as there was plenty of entertainment for children of all ages or time and space just to sit and watch the animals.
reviews.title: A Dream Come True

likes.liked: — being able to see savannah animals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was soo looking forward to staying here but quite frankly it just does not live up to the hype. This was my 7th visit to Disney and my first and defiantly last visit to the animal lodge . Its just not very good value for money . We were in room 3431 which in theory gave a good view of the “savannah” but its not really a savannah its just a bit of greenery in between hotel rooms with a few animals that come out when fed . We only saw them at around 7ish each evening when they were fed and there were the same ones every day – 2 giraffe a couple of zebras and some cow things with big horns, I saw more bunny rabbits than anything else ! In addition we mainly looked over the public viewing area which was ugly to look at and due to the lack of animals resulted in more people staring at me than the savannah! There is another savannah at the back of the hotel which you can also view form the pool area which has more interesting animals and baby giraffes so if you pay all those extra dollars for a savannah view like I did make sure you ask to be on that side as I can’t recommend where we were !
reviews.title: Over priced not many animals and dark rooms

likes.liked: — The animals when they turned up
likes.disliked: — Location (too far from other Dinsey parks)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very small and very dark . The do not disturb sign and pre order for breakfast was removed after the 2nd day and not returned ! The pool was very busy and if you want a child free swim then first thing in the morning is your only chance as there is just the one pool . In addition there was no bath only a shower – I really do expect for a hotel of this price to have a choice of cleaning facilities ! The room was VERY basic to say the least .
reviews.title: Great Atmosphere and Theme

reviews.text: We did not venture into Boma as it looked like hell on earth with screaming kids everywhere . Hoping for a more adult orientated meal we booked Jiko for 9.20 one evening (be warned at Disney you need to book ALL meals in advance) . The food was average and even then there was still plenty of children when we first arrived so may not be the romantic meal you planned for if you dine any earlier . The after dinner cocktail was heaven though and service good.
reviews.title: fantastic place

reviews.text: We are DVC members but never stayed here before. It is my new favorite! Great vibe, beautiful lighting. So relaxing. Love the Savanah view. Always chsnging, one day I woke up to 4 giraffes outside my room! Loved Bomas too.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's Disney so the resort is of a standard with some nice touches. We felt the room was a tad small and it is just as well Disney does not let Sofitel give them competition but it was OK. Apart from the Wi-Fi which was rubbish. 6.5mbps in our room? Welcome to the stone age.
reviews.title: Nice animals, rubbish Wi-Fi

reviews.text: Some of us need to keep in touch with work to pay for the 'Magic' but if you need to log on to your online banking, forget it. You bank will boot you for a time-out by the time the rubbish Wi-Fi has connected you.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time!

reviews.text: There is 32mbps Wi-Fi in reception. There is also screaming kids, people checking in and out and fat people shooting about in motorised wheelchairs. This is hardly condusive to doing a half hours work whilst on holiday.
reviews.title: Resort has everything, plus some

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Get it sorted Mickey Mouse and your Assistants.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, average accomodations.

description: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is an African lodge-style resort amidst a 43-acre wildlife preserve. The Resort offers authentic African-inspired architecture and the kraal African-village landscape design—a semi-circle design popular in Africa which offers expansive views of the surrounding savanna and its many animal inhabitants.
